chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Arlene R. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Identity Theft- Financial Gain [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Granting Motion to Terminate and Administrative Transfer Out of Treatment Court
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED: the defendant's participation in Treatment Court is terminated and the case shall be administratively transferred to the court of origin, Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 2, for further proceedings.
/s/ July 15, 2015

IT IS ORDERED: This case is transferred to Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 4 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program. The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.

Staying Jail Time
IT IS ORDERED the defendant's remaining jail time is hereby ordered stayed as of noon on July 21, 2014. The jail time will remain stayed pending good standing status in the Treatment Court and will be waived in the event the defendant continues with successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program requirements. The stayed jail time may be re-imposed for good cause.
